item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, January 27, 2025 at 1:10 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Kansas tuberculosis outbreak is now America's largest in recorded history (98 points | 27 comments)
2. Openhaystack: Build 'AirTags' – track Bluetooth devices via Apple's network (25 points | 1 comment)
3. Shunpo: Minimalist bash tool to make directory navigation a little bit faster (12 points | 3 comments)
4. The leading AI models are now good historians (114 points | 80 comments)
5. Lessons in creating family photos that people want to keep (2018) (21 points | 8 comments)
6. Show HN: 3D printing giant things with a Python jigsaw generator (48 points | 4 comments)
7. Show HN: DeepSeek My User Agent (186 points | 80 comments)
8. Qwen2.5-1M: Deploy your own Qwen with context length up to 1M tokens (110 points | 56 comments)
9. Amsterdam Compiler Kit for Cray X-MP (43 points | 5 comments)
10. Astronomers delete asteroid because it turned out to be Tesla Roadster (126 points | 41 comments)
11. Hyperbound (YC S23) is hiring a Founding Account Executive in SF ( | hide)
12. The protester's guide to smartphone security (259 points | 131 comments)
13. Using the most unhinged AVX-512 instruction to make fastest phrase search algo (90 points | 23 comments)
14. Hard numbers in the Wayland vs. X11 input latency discussion (361 points | 238 comments)
15. Dualities in Functional Programming (13 points | 2 comments)
16. Show HN: A new native app for 20 year old OS X (76 points | 11 comments)
17. No one is disrupting banks – at least not the big ones (80 points | 142 comments)
18. The Microsoft 365 Copilot launch was a disaster (293 points | 291 comments)
19. So you wanna write Kubernetes controllers? (94 points | 47 comments)
20. The impact of competition and DeepSeek on Nvidia (94 points | 39 comments)
21. Reviving a Dead Audio Format: The Return of ZZM (72 points | 5 comments)
22. Show HN: Orange intelligence, an open source alternative to Apple Intelligence (48 points | 7 comments)
23. From tiny to immense: Geological spotlight on the Alexander Mosaic (3 points | discuss)
24. Two Bites of Data Science in K (20 points | 4 comments)
25. 100 years of Bell Labs [pdf] (66 points | 5 comments)
26. OpenJazz is a free, open-source version of the classic Jazz Jackrabbit games (18 points | 2 comments)
27. The only photo of the Concorde flying at supersonic speed (73 points | 46 comments)
28. AI slop, suspicion, and writing back (194 points | 160 comments)
29. Another undersea cable damaged in Baltic Sea (128 points | 106 comments)
30. The South Vietnamese pilot who landed a Cessna on a carrier to save his family (2019) (338 points | 168 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, January 27, 2025 at 1:10 AM UTC
